entries.meaning: (law, computing) A list or set of people or entities to be shunned or banned.
examples: The software included a lengthy blacklist of disreputable websites to block.

verbs.description: blacklist (third-person singular simple present blacklists, present participle blacklisting, simple past and past participle blacklisted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To place on a blacklist; to mark a person or entity as one to be shunned or banned.
examples: You can blacklist known spammers with that button.
